message.content: cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MED, cs.NEURON - The paper deals with medical imaging and proposes the use of adversarial training for segmentation networks to improve the detection of aggressive prostate cancer. This involves the use of deep neural networks, which are commonly studied in the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the challenges of working with medical imaging data, which is a topic of interest in the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The use of MRI images and the focus on cancer detection also suggest that the paper could be relevant to the medical imaging (cs.MED) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a novel approach to training segmentation networks, which could be of interest to researchers in the neural networks (cs.NEURON) sub-category.
